events.title: The Ministry of Health (MoH) of Guinea notifies WHO of a rapidly evolving outbreak of Ebola virus disease. 112 cases including 70 deaths (case fatality ratio: 62.5%) reported subsequently
Liberia reports two cases of Ebola. One death.

Sierra Leone starts investigating suspected cases of EVD. Guinea has reported a cumulative total of 224 clinical cases of Ebola Virus Disease (EVD), including 143 deaths. Liberia has reported a total of 35 clinically compatible cases of EVD
Sierra Leone reports 16 cases, (7 laboratory-confirmed, 9 suspected) and 5 community deaths. Guinea has reported a cumulative total of 291 clinical cases of EVD, including 193 deaths so far.

Cumulative number of cases and deaths reported from Guinea to 390 (260 confirmed, 87 probable, and 43 suspected) and 270 deaths. Cumulative number of cases and deaths reported from Sierra Leone to 158 (147 confirmed, 8 probable, and 3 suspected) and 34 deaths from confirmed cases. Cumulative number of cases and deaths reported from Liberia to 51 (34 confirmed, 10 probable, and 7 suspected) and 34 deaths.

Nigeria reports its first case of EVD. The distribution and classification of the cases are as follows: Guinea, 460 cases (336 confirmed, 109 probable, and 15 suspected) including 339 deaths; Liberia, 329 cases (100 confirmed, 128 probable, and 101 suspected) including 156 deaths; Nigeria, 1 case (1 probable who died); and Sierra Leone, 533 cases (473 confirmed, 38 probable, and 22 suspected) including 233 deaths.
American doctor, Kent Brantley, who contracted the deadly Ebola virus while working for a Christian aid organisation in Liberia released from hospital after recovering.
British national in Sierra Leone contracts Ebola.
Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) reports outbreak of EVD
Senegal reports one case of EVD.
EVD spreads to two new countires, DRC and Senegal. WHO says Ebola cases may exceed 20,000 over emergency period. Total Cases/Death: 3685/1841.
Ebola virus may have been contained in Nigeria and Senegal as no new cases reported. WHO says number of deaths from EVD has crossed 3000.
First confirmed imported case of Ebola Virus Disease (EVD) in the United States. CDC says the US is ready.
American journalist in Liberia diagnosed with Ebola.
